Detailed Description

Implementations of routines used to manipulate tables of active connected hosts and nodes cache.

int llp_add_node_to_cache ( struct sockaddr_in *  address  ) 

Adds a node to the node pool. If there's no room to store this node, it will substitute the first inactive node found. If the node is already there, LLP_ERROR is returned.

Parameters:
address node address and port.
Returns:
LLP_OK if no errors occurred, LLP_ERROR otherwise.

int llp_get_inactive_node ( struct sockaddr_in *  address  ) 

Copies the address of an inactive node on cache to address. If there's no inactive node on cache, LLP_ERROR is returned.

Parameters:
address address that will receive the node address.
Returns:
LLP_OK if there was a inactive onde on cache, LLP_ERROR otherwise.

int llp_get_nodes_from_cache ( int  number,
struct sockaddr_in *  addresses 
)

Copies the addresses of n nodes on cache to the array. If there's no nodes on cache, LLP_ERROR is returned. The array must be pre-allocated with enough capacity to store all addresses.

Parameters:
number number of addresses requested.
addresses array that will receive the node address.
Returns:
number of nodes found, LLP_ERROR if errors occurred.
